name: src/doc-types.js

properties.name: id
properties.description:
The component class name, used by the {@link ResourceProvider}
 to pull the component class.

name: EntityData
examples:
<caption>ID: 'objects.sphere'</caption>
objects = {
    sphere: {
        _primaryMesh: 'MyMeshComponent',

        MyMeshComponent: {position: {x: 0, y: 5, z: 0}},
        MyLogicComponent: {value: 'foobar'}
    }
};

properties.name: _primaryMesh
properties.description:
Optional ID of component that holds entity's
 primary mesh object.

name: EntityMetaData
examples:
<caption>Advanced Definition</caption>
let entityData2 = {
    id: 'objects.sphere',
    uid: 'mySecondSphere',
    MyMeshComponent: {rotation: {y: Math.PI},
    MyLogicComponent: {value: 42} // This will override the default definition.
};

properties.name: id
properties.description:
The generic Entity ID, used by the {@link ResourceProvider}
 to pull the data.

properties.name: uid
properties.description: The unique identifier for the entity instance.

properties.name: mesh
properties.description:
The component that holds the primary mesh
 object for the entity.

types: function(engine: Engine, time: number, deltaTime: number): undefined
properties.name: tick
properties.description: Executes all registered component tick methods.

properties.name: meshAsync
properties.description:
Wait for entity's mesh component to be
 set and get the value, asynchronously.

name: ComponentClass
examples:
<caption>Basic Logic Component</caption>
class MyLogicComponent {
    constructor(engine, entity, id, {value}) {
        this.id = id;
        this.value = value;
        this.enabled = true;
        entity.tick = {id, tick: MyLogicComponent.tick};
        return comp;
    }
    disableMe() {
        this.enabled = false;
    }
    static update(engine, entity, comp, id, data) {
        if (!comp) {
            comp = new MyLogicComponent(engine, entity, id, data);
        } else {
            comp.value = data.value;
        }
        return comp;
    }
    static dismount(engine, entity, comp) {
        delete comp.value;
        return null;
    }
    static tick(engine, entity, comp, t, dt) {
        if (comp.enabled) {
            engine.ctrl.target.AnotherComponent.doSomething(comp.value);
        }
    }
}

<caption>BabylonJS Object Wrapper</caption>
class MyMeshComponent {
    static create(engine, entity, id, meshData) {
        const comp = {id, baby: null};

        return someFancyAsyncAction().then(() => {
            comp.baby = engine.GL.Mesh.CreateSphere('mySphere', 10, 2, engine.scene.baby);
            _.assign(comp.baby, meshData);
            return comp;
         });
    static update(engine, entity, comp, id, data) {
        if (!comp) {
            return this.create(engine, entity, id, data);
        }
        _.assign(comp.baby, data);
        return Promise.resolve(comp);
    }
    static dismount(engine, entity, comp) {
         comp.baby.dispose();
         delete comp.baby;
         return null;
    }
}

properties.name: getEntity
properties.description: Raw object containing default component definitions for Entity ID.

properties.name: getComponent
properties.description: Static component class for Component ID.

types: function(engine: Engine, k: string, down: bool)
type.name: KeyHandler

properties.description: The handler specifically for key up.

properties.name: downHandler

name: src/engine.js
Engine
description: The game engine class (abstraction of BabylonJS Engine).
examples:
<caption>Basic construction with default args</caption>
let engine = Engine.init(logger, () => Promise.resolve(resourceProvider));

<caption>One-line runner</caption>
Engine.init(myLogger, myResourceLazyLoader, MyPlayerCtrl, settings)
    .mount(document.getElementById('my-canvas'))
    .then(engine => engine.run(entityData))
    .then(engine => window.addEventListener('resize', () => engine.resize()));

name: init
description:
The general creation/initialization method for the class. Creates an
engine instance or returns the existing one if already instantiated.

name: constructorHelper
description: For testing purposes -- cannot stub constructor

name: constructorHelper
description: For testing purposes -- cannot stub constructor

name: fps
description: The currently rendered frames-per-second.

name: loading
description: The current loading state of the engine.

name: GL
description: The BabylonJS graphics library.

name: baby
description: The BabylonJS.Engine instance.

name: canvas
description: The canvas element to which the engine has been mounted.

name: terrain
description: The scene's default terrain entity.

name: mount
description: Mount the engine to the given canvas.

name: dismount
description: Dismount engine from canvas.

name: run
description: Initialize given entities (if any), then begin rendering to mounted canvas.

name: stop
description: Stop the rendering loop.

name: resize
description: Passthrough to BabylonJS.Engine#resize method.

name: toVector
description: Creates a new BabylonJS.Vector3.

name: emitDebugEvent
description: Emits the given state event, only when settings.debug = true. See {@link Engine#emitEvent}.

name: onDebugEvent
description: Adds state event listener only when settings.debug = true. See {@link Engine#onEvent}.

name: emitEvent
description: Emits the given state event.

params.name: scope
params.description: The scoped event name (e.g., 'engine.fps').

params.name: v
params.description: The changed value.

params.name: obj
params.description: The parent object who's property changed.

name: onEvent
description: Registers a listener method for a state event.

params.name: event
params.description: The scoped event name.

params.name: handler
params.description: The event handler.

name: registerKeyAction
description: Hooks a Keyboard Key action listener into the engine.

params.name: key
params.description: The event key to listen for (e.g., 'w', 'a', 's', 'd', ' ', etc.).

params.name: handlers.downHandler
params.description: Handler method for KeyDown event.

params.name: handlers.upHandler
params.description: Handler method for KeyUp event.

params.name: handlers.handler
params.description: Handler method for both events.

name: registerMouseEventsForEntity
description: Hooks Mouse action listener(s) into the engine for a given Entity.

params.name: opts.click
params.description: Hooks the left-click (or equivalent) when true.

params.name: opts.altClick
params.description: Hooks the right-click (or equivalent) when true.

params.name: opts.over
params.description: Hooks the mouse-over when true.

params.name: opts.out
params.description: Hooks the mouse-out when true.

params.name: opts.cursor
params.description: Changes the mouse-over cursor when set.

name: deregisterMouseEventsForEntity
description: Removes all Mouse action listeners and mouse-over cursor for a given entity.

name: LoadStates
description: The various states of Engine#loading.

name: src/player-controller.js
PlayerController
description: Controller for player logic and interactions.
examples:
<caption>Definition</caption>
class MyGamePlayerController extends PlayerController {
    get DOM_EVENTS() {
        return {contextmenu: 'mAltClick', click: 'myClickMethod'};
    }
    entityOver(entity, event) {
        super.entityOver(entity, event);
        entity.MyActionableComponent.doAction();
    }
    entityClick(entity, {pointerX, pointerY}) {
        let {x, y, z} = this.engine.scene.baby.pick(pointerX, pointerY).pickedPoint;

        this.player.MyOtherActionableComponent.beginMovementTo(x, y, z);
    }
    myClickMethod(event) {
        this.player.DestructionComponent.killAllHumans();
    }
}

properties.name: MAX_MESSAGES
properties.description: The maximum number of messages to keep in the array.

name: getTime
description: Used for generating readable-timestamps in messages.

name: DOM_EVENTS
description:
Map of HTML DOM events to controller functions to be hooked into the window
when engine is mounted.
examples:
<caption>Override DOM_EVENTS</caption>
get DOM_EVENTS() { return {click: 'mClick'}; }
// Only the browser click action will trigger a Controller method.

params.name: engine
params.description: The reference to the parent game engine.

name: messages
description:
The list of logged game messages. New messages are inserted into the
beginning of the array.

name: player
description: The controlled player entity.

name: target
description: The currently-targeted entity (based on mouse-over).

name: engine
description: Reference to the parent game engine instance.

name: setup
description:
Supplies the key listeners defined in the provided game settings to
 {@link PlayerController#registerKeyActions}.

name: registerKeyActions
description: Hooks the provided key handlers into the game's keystroke actions.

name: message
description: Inserts new message into controller's messages array.

name: entityOver

name: entityOut

 second decimal place.

name: src/scene/scene.js

params.name: dt
params.description: The elapsed miliseconds since the last tick.

name: src/state-event-proxy.js

emits.description:
emits event name scoped to property change for proxied
 properties.

name: EventProxy
description: Convenience function that passes through to {@link StateEventProxy.create}.
examples:
<caption>Property Keys</caption>
EventProxy(myObject, 'myObject', ['myPropA', 'myPropB']);
console.log(myObject) // {myPropA: undefined, myPropB: undeinfed}
myObject.myPropA = 10; // Emits event w/ args: 'myObject.myPropA', 10, myObject
myObject.myPropB = {}; // Emits event w/ args: 'myObject.myPropB', {}, myObject
console.log(myObject) // {myPropA: 10, myPropB: {}}

<caption>Property Map</caption>
EventProxy(myObject, 'myObject', {
    myPropA: 42,
    myPropB: {foo: 'bar'}
});
console.log(myObject) // {myPropA: 42, myPropB: {foo: 'bar'}}
myObject.myPropA = 10; // Emits event w/ args: 'myObject.myPropA', 10, myObject
myObject.myPropB.foo = 'foo'; // Does not emit an event.
console.log(myObject) // {myPropA: 10, myPropB: {foo: 'foo'}}

<caption>Property Map w/ Deep Proxy</caption>
EventProxy(myObject, 'myObject', {
    myPropA: [{id: 'foo'}, {id: 'bar'}],
    myPropB: {a: 1, b: 2, c: 3}
}, {deep: true});
console.log(myObject) // {myPropA: [{id: 'foo'}, {id: 'bar'}], myPropB: {a: 1, b: 2, c: 3}}
myObject.myPropB.a = 0; // Emits event w/ args: 'myObject.myPropB.a', 0, myObject.myPropB
myObject.myPropB = {}; // Emits event w/ args: 'myObject.myPropB', {}, myObject
myObject.myPropA[0].id = 42; // Emits event w/ args: 'myObject.myPropA[0].id', 42, myObject.myPropA[0]
myObject.myPropA.push('foobar'); // Emits event w/ args: 'myObject.myPropA', myObject.myPropA, myObject
console.log(myObject) // {myPropA: [{id: 42}, {id: 'bar'}, 'foobar'], myPropB: {}}

name: StateEventProxy
description: The StateEventProxy class.
